SENT.plain: In a 14-year-old boy, neurological signs (fall in visual acuity, signs of raised intracranial pressure) led to a diagnosis of stenosis of the aqueduct of Sylvius
Cure was obtained by insertion of a ventriculo-cardiac bypass (Holter's valve)
Endocrine signs (delayed growth, excessweight, loss of circadian variations in cortisol levels) regressed in a few months after the operation
Amongst endocrine manifestations of stenosis of the aqueduct, delayed growth and disturbances in gonadal function are the most common, together with obesity
They usually regress after neurosurgical treatment
